{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Haddon Matrix is a conceptual model that is used in the field of injury prevention. It was developed by William Haddon, a public health physician, in the 1970s. The matrix is used to identify factors that contribute to injuries and to develop strategies to prevent them. It is not related to communicable diseases, maternal and child mortality, or hypertensive disorders.", "answer_choice": "A"}
